title: Fix a minor typo in Steering Committee Backlog
change a few priorities and add a few items
body:
This is a follow up from https://github.com/kubernetes/community/issues/351#issuecomment-321859055

Which became: https://github.com/kubernetes/community/pull/899

there are lots of details to think about with governance. In my view the bootstrap committee is laying the ground work to seed a steering committee, but this steering committee will need to create "bylaws" which will explain:

- the membership ( and process to navigate this membership)
- the election process for the steering committee -DONE
- discussion, voting processes throughout the projects (how are decisions made)
- where the community lives (do we expect all members of standing to be on slack ? which channel ?)
- the incubator (we need a committee there to vote on graduation and incubation)
- the governance of the sigs 

When that is in place the adequate membership can discuss and vote on mechanisms to take technical decisions...

title: Split up charter into charter and elections.
body:
Per conversations.  This PR splits out language from the original charter document that no longer applies to a scoped down charter and election documents. 

Also per other conversations, I left the modifications to the elections document as a TBD.

found in the transcript within https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3zUB8R53HFM

(I think) resolves #19

title: Document process changes to steering committee governance
body:
The following captures in words what was discussed in our past meetings.

The procedure allows for 4 weeks when making significant changes to governance.  Changes are lazily approved after 4 weeks if no-one calls for a vote.  If a vote is requested, changes are passed with 3/4 majority.

title: backlog: update items for next sprint
body:
- remove governance docs as completed
- pull in "improve the incubator process" since it turns we've been working on that this past month
- pull in "formalize the concept of subprojects" since it turns we've been working on that this past month
- pull in "SIG charter template, including suggested governance and minimum required"
- keep "update project values"
- keep "intra-SIG governance" (is there anything left to do beyond the aforementioned SIG charter item?)
- push "resolve the disconnect between code/people org" into backlog, subprojects covers enough scope for a month

title: Move values.md from steering to the community repo
body:
This PR removes `values.md` from the steering repo and https://github.com/kubernetes/community/pull/3103 adds it to the community repo.

Since this document talks about community values, it seems apt to place it in the "kubernetes/community" repo and have it be more discoverable.

/cc @dims @spiffxp @sarahnovotny @parispittman @cblecker 

/sig contributor-experience
/committee steering
/hold
